title.value: Finding Increasingly Large Extremal Graphs with AlphaZero and Tabu Search
title.justification: This is the title mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Finding Increasingly Large Extremal Graphs with AlphaZero and Tabu Search

extractions.description: This paper investigates an extremal graph theory problem to find graphs with a given size that maximize the number of edges without having 3- or 4-cycles. The study formulates this as a sequential decision-making problem and compares AlphaZero, a neural-network guided tree search, with tabu search, a heuristic local search method.

type.justification: The paper focuses on implementing and comparing the performance of two methods, AlphaZero and tabu search, for finding extremal graphs.
type.quote: We formulate this problem as a sequential decision-making problem and compare AlphaZero, a neural network-guided tree search, with tabu search, a heuristic local search method.

name.justification: The paper applies AI techniques like AlphaZero and tabu search to solve an extremal graph theory problem.
name.quote: In this paper, we use reinforcement learning (RL) and formulate graph generation as a sequential decision making process.

name.justification: The paper utilizes AlphaZero, which is based on reinforcement learning.
name.quote: As our RL agent, we use the state-of-the-art AlphaZero[36] algorithm.

name.justification: The problem being addressed is an extremal graph theory problem involving finding graphs with specific properties.
name.quote: This work studies a central extremal graph theory problem inspired by a 1975 conjecture of ErdoÌ‹s.

name.justification: AlphaZero is one of the primary models used in the study.
name.quote: In this paper, we use reinforcement learning (RL) and formulate graph generation as a sequential decision making process [...] As our RL agent, we use the state-of-the-art AlphaZero[36] algorithm.

is_contributed.justification: AlphaZero itself is not a new contribution of this paper; it is an existing model.
is_contributed.quote: As our RL agent, we use the state-of-the-art AlphaZero[36] algorithm.

is_executed.justification: AlphaZero is executed in the experiments conducted in the paper.
is_executed.quote: In this paper, we use reinforcement learning (RL) and formulate graph generation as a sequential decision making process.

is_compared.justification: AlphaZero is compared with tabu search in the study.
is_compared.quote: We formulate this problem as a sequential decision-making problem and compare AlphaZero, a neural network-guided tree search, with tabu search.

referenced_paper_title.value: Mastering the game of go without human knowledge
referenced_paper_title.justification: The original paper on AlphaZero that is referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: As our RL agent, we use the state-of-the-art AlphaZero[36] algorithm, which has shown tremendous success in a variety of domains such as tensor decomposition [15], discovering new sorting algorithms [27] and game playing [36].

name.justification: AlphaFold is mentioned as related work in the context of using neural network-guided tree search.
name.quote: The recent work of AlphaTensor [15] also relies on neural network-guided tree search to find novel tensor decompositions that result in faster matrix multiplication algorithms.

referenced_paper_title.value: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with AlphaFold
referenced_paper_title.justification: The original paper on AlphaFold that is referenced.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The recent work of AlphaTensor [15] also relies on neural network-guided tree search to find novel tensor decompositions that result in faster matrix multiplication algorithms.
